name: hollis
text: I love the nerd/geek distinction.  So true!

name: trollcollins
text:
The definitive word on geeks, nerds, and dorks:
http://catandgirl.com/view.php?loc=94

name: saru
text:
Huh. That's a pretty good one.
The different opinions on the meanings of nerd and geek (and occasionally the related term "dork") has long been a personal fixation for me.

name: vulpes-aurum
text:
Dorks:

[IMGS OFF]

name: charchar
text:
Much as I love Cat and Girl, I take sharp issue with Girl's definiton:
geeks are more left-brained, excelling in technical things like programming or whatever mathy stuff they do.
Nerds (such as myself) are often more linguistically inclined, and seldom of any use to the world at large.
A dork is any socially awkward human, a trait often found in conjunction with geekiness & nerdiness, but not necessarily causal or correlating.

I now side my spectacles up my nose and anticipate wedgies to come.

name: tellumo
text: No wedgies from me, although I'll have to ask to see your special permit.

name: charchar
text: Alright; it's been a week and I have yet to formulate a reply with a suitable balance of snark and grace. I stand accused of geekery without licence. You are the winner. Damn you, tellumo damn you .

name: i_love_kate
text: Linguistically inclined equates to nerd? To hell with that. I'm a square, and I'll push anyone who tries to tell me different!

name: boredom_man
text:
There are other categories, of course. A square is a sober linguist; a nerd is drunk (or, in Charchar's case, fated to alcohol abuse in the manner of a mile-wide mudslide about to bury Talladega's one tourist).

Girl's usually wrong about stuff; she's the set-up character. Cat's the wise one: "A hipster walks into a bar and says this bar's full of hipsters." Or Grrl, of course: "I'll have the patties hearst."

As will we all, Grrl. As will we all.

name: vulpes-aurum
text: It's hip to be square.

name: kalethan
text: you mean, you'll press on them?

name: soticoto
text:
I'm inclined to disagree...
Geeks and Nerds are both left-brained. However Nerds are more practical, while Geeks operate on a private flavour of "rule of cool".
I suppose it depends most which you'd find cooler: the world's most powerful mass spectrometer, or a 1:1 scale model of the millenium falcon that can actually fly... a bit.

name: chivalress
text: Although it seems that Beef is not giving himself enough credit; while technical studies are obviously his forte, Ray still called him "Mr. Quotes Tori Amos During His Salutorian Address."  Sounds like he was reasonably well-rounded.

name: alilsneaky
text: FeeRrreep sassing RB , calling him a nerd n all that, isn't that a bit out of character for the little guy?

name: alilsneaky
text: Nvm , just finished reading and turns out he was all doped up on coke (the fizzy kind ofcourse).

name: hannah
text: new shoes! philippe was so excited about new shoes that he stayed up late. i love that otter.

name: tttt
text:
he doesn't even feel the need to elaborate

'new shoes' is clearly enough explanation for why he was up late

name: cracker
text: The Otter is Five and he has new shoes. No activity must be specified.

name: cracklewater
text:
He seems to be hyperactive from the coke.

The whole piece gives me a powerful imaged of Philippe wired to the eyeballs on caffeine and sugar - rushing about, throwing fruit, breaking things and showing his butt to Mr Bear.

Junior meth-binge! BLEEEEEEEEE!

name: epicurus
text: A comment left by epicurus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Pseudochron, fosters, ohmygooses, Direhaggis, goodgravy)

name: gouldgonewild
text: A comment left by gouldgonewild was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Pseudochron, ohmygooses, Direhaggis)

name: sargasm
text: I can just picture him typing out a paragraph and then going to do something terrible like throwing an orange at the fridge, then coming back to feverishly write about it before taking off again.

name: zaer
text: That is journalism

name: qwerty
text: Coke theft? Faucet sprayings? Sounds like Phillipe is getting all hell of SASSY.

name: rotating-dog
text: Hell of BLEEEEEEEEE!

name: ibetso
text: He's being a Holy Hell actually.

name: caduceo
text: coca cola turns phillipe into a proper home wrecking otter.

name: falseprophet
text: Meanwhile, Coke PLUS makes him see the future.

name: woodenteeth
text: He is still five and so decides not to drink Coke PLUS again.

name: tombsgrave
text: Harry Potter fanfition at his age? I can so empathize.

name: honesttom
text: I love the picture there. The huge eyes, the arms thrown backwards by sheer speed, the expression on Cornelius' face... hell, even the fact that Phillipe must be on stilts there.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Now that I look at it again, perhaps he's jumping while running forward?  Like running around the table, bouncing up and down?  That might be a better explanation for Connie's drink spillage.

name: fancyrat
text: I looked at the picture before reading the paper and wondered if Onstad meant for Mr. Bear to look so angry, or if it was a Mona Lisa kind of thing. Otter-ass whilst eating is not a fun thing.

name: katsura
text: anddddddddddddddddddddd[]\

name: domini
text: He stayed up way too late because of NEW SHOES!

name: soticoto
text: Chubby for your avatar.

name: saint
text: Priests in Holy Hell wear Hawaiian tourist attire.

name: charchar
text: and capes

name: falseprophet
text: Philippe's prose is approaching quality of the Faulknerian caliber towards the end. Kudos, Philippe.

name: philosophe
text:
In this strip:

Phillipe gets all jacked up off caffeine and perform houshold antics!

name: soticoto
text:
Otters watch Tree Shrews on Animal Planet?

... What do Tree Shrews watch on Animal Planet?

name: tekende
text: In Soviet Russia, Tree Shrews watch YOU! On Human Planet!

name: senorspangiel
text:
Cornelius Bear

Old, and eating dinner

name: mattylite
text: Old and Eating Dinner: The Cornelius Bear Story.

name: dwodles
text: "Vol. 7! No. 8!"  Leave it to Phillipe to add exclamation points to show how far he's come.

name: breadcrab
text: This is my favorite Friday Facts!, it really is. Mostly for the pic of Cornelius eating dinner.

name: deusoma
text: It's clear that he is deeply upset by the sight of naked Phillipe.

name: achilleselbow
text: It's good that Philippe reminded us that he is old. Otherwise we may have forgotten.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Roast Beef: Granite

name: direhaggis
text: The pure joy of Philippe baring his ass to Mr. Bear warms my heart endlessly.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: success

name: nicolae
text:
The sleeveless outer robe of a priest saying mass is called a "chausable." Friday fun fact!

(Ironically I only learned this through my studies in Satanism)

name: cagliostro
text:
(chasuble)

(sorry)

name: bozendoka
text: 5'd because I can totally hear the writing getting faster and faster after he drinks the Coke. Hooray!

name: fuzzyshoo
text:
Every time I read "so cold and tasty!", I want a Coke.

That's some serious marketing.

name: carlyle
text: Mr. Bear upset his glass at the site of Phillipe's butt which is something you do not show others.

name: edana
text: The main flavor in coke may be cola but the SECRET flavor is nutmeg.

name: greenkoolayd
text: its not secret anymore......

name: darthtrainman
text: I understand Philippe's Situation. Just last week, I consumed in excess of three cups of coffee and four bottles of Pepsi, and went into a sort fugue-like state during which I wrote all five papers I had due the following day. It was brutal.
